story:
The DIY GPS tracker!

A movie is not necessary here! The photos speak for itself. Together with the best Italian and Russian GPS specialists we managed to make the smallest complete GPS GSM tracker in the world. This tracker is only 25 x 25 mm! With the onboard STM32 microcontroller you can program it yourself with Arduino or online (!) with Mbed.org or in C using Keil or the opensource CooCox IDE. Almost anybody can do the programming with their own beloved platform.


It means that now with AnyTracer Anybody can track literally Anything where you have a GSM network! It can be your luggage, parcel in the mail, your child during holidays, your bicycle trip, your marathon, your boat, your airplane, your high altitude balloon, your car or other belongings in the way YOU want it. As the name says anything goes! Be creative and let us know what you are using it for!

AnyTracer also has an onboard accelerometer. Google for it and see why and how this can be helpful.

AnyTracer's components
STM32 microcontroller - the beating heart
GL865 Telit modem - can be additionally programmed with python
Quectel L30 GPS - including A-GPS
MMA8652 accelerometer - one of the best
Macronix MX25L8006E CMOS Serial Flash - to store 1000 's of data
GPIO pins - to hook on other devices

The wonderful part of it is that you can program the AnyTracer yourself with sketches and scripts we will make for you, made by the AnyTracer's community or with the ones you make yourself. You can also adapt our scripts or use any open source scripts you can find. Your own imagination is the limit!

You can help & get AnyTracer for free!


By submitting useful and new software written by yourself for AnyTracer's tracker or server, you receive from us 1 complete AnyTracer for FREE. We will make this software available to the rest of the Arduino, Mbed and/or C programming community on the net.

We will also give away for FREE 5 AnyTracers to people who have the best new ideas to use AnyTracer. So submit your ideas to us! After the campaign has ended our team will select the winners.

What we need & What you get

We have already the hardware, software and server design. We have also proved already that it works very well.

On the map above you see how we tracked a wild otter (Lutra lutra) with one of the first prototypes of AnyTracer!

However we need you to make the following possible:

1) Manufacture the boards;

2) Make for you a set of example sketches with which you can do track and trace;

3) Make for you a handy open source GPS tracking app for your smartphone;

You can get from us:

1) Eternal gratitude with virtual bows;

2) If you can spend more, also a nice certificate;

3) The real thing, the AnyTracer, to do it yourself with a proud feeling that you did it yourself;

Our own hacked toaster reflow oven with on the right its controller

4) The real thing assembled by ourselves with a cascade of dedication and love for this neat little tracker.

Go for it and pick one of the perks on the right!

The Impact

With AnyTracer you can track and trace anything you like. It is fun to do and can be very helpful for anything and anybody.

The Internet of Things (IoT)

AnyTracer will become one of the valuable tools in the Internet of Things (IoT), because it is so small and it can connect to anything through the World Wide Web.

SIM on chip

The AnyTracer can be so small, because it has a SIM card in the shape of a chip. It is soldered to the PCB. Any kind of subscription is possible from prepaid to a monthly subscription. Through us you can make a choice of several providers. The billing is handled by yourself.


Shipment

The first 100 claims for each perk which need shipment will receive their AnyTracer without shipping costs. So claim your AnyTracer as soon as possible!

 

After this amount we will let you know what the shipping costs are for unregistered mail (cheap) and registered mail. The last is a bit more, but not too much, because it is only a small parcel.

Battery

AnyTracer uses a 3.7 Volt (4.2 V maximum) Lion or LiPo battery. Other batteries cannot be used! We will include one 500 mAh LiPo battery and LiPo/Lion charger for FREE!

Server software

You wil get our PHP server software with Leaflet mapping and MySQL database to receive, save and show the GPS data for FREE. 

The copyright of this software remains ours, but you are free to change the code for your own need. If you do not have experience with setting up such server and database we can do it for you for only 25 euro's on your own server!

Enclosure

During the campaign we will show you how you can make yourself nice looking, cheap and waterproof enclosures for your tracker.

Other ways you can help

Some of you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • For this you can use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

Spin off

The AnyTracer is a spin off of the CatTracer we are also developing right now. This is a big challenge, because the CatTracer involves also the making of a super light weight and comfortable collar. We have found the right solution for this. If you are more into tracking cats (or other animals) hop over to CatTracers's blog at: http://cattracer.wordpress.com/.

AnyTracer at reportcrowd

FEATURED ON:

Electronics Lab



FEATURED ON:

dutchcowboys.nl

story:
Short Summary

My name is Coach Melvin Russell Sr. I am a 62 year old retired teacher/coach from Shreveport La. I am married to Mary A. Russell and we have five children and 7 grandchildren. I found out I had cysts growing on my kidneys through a routine checkup. By the time I found out, my kidneys were functioning at 25%. Within 9 months they were down to 5%. I started dialysis 3 years ago, 3 days a week, 4 hours per day. I need to complete my transplant and get back to working full-time. I have too much life and too much to contribute to be stuck on dialysis. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • I am setting the amount at $12,000 because I have already raised $13,000 through friends, relatives,neighbors and fund-raisers.
  • My hospital, Baylor All Saints in Fort Worth TX set a goal of $25,000 to help cover the very expensive anti-rejection medicine and other expenses that I will incur after the operation. I have insurance, but these expenses will be generated over and above what the insurance will pay. 
  • Also, my son who has agreed, and who has matched me, will have expenses as well, and will have to take off work and be placed on light duty for a while and this will put him and his family in a tough position until he can get back to work full-time. 
  • The funds will go to pay for medicine. Any addition funds will be donated to Robin's Haven of Hope, a non profit org. that is helping disadvantaged individuals with organ donation, liver disease, and kidney disease. 

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • As spokes person, and the face of Robin's Haven of Hope, I am attempting to lead the way in educating minority individual on the importance of organ donation and getting tested for diseases that if caught early enough can extend their lives and add to their quality of life. Since I am a well known figure in the community I hope my situation will bring about the necessary awareness that can save lives. 
  • In our last fund raiser we were able to test over 100 individuals for HEP-C and AIDS and HIV. 
  •  We were successful in identifying 9 people that tested positive. We were successful in helping those people get the necessary medicine and in getting them the medical help that can possibly lead them to be cured. 
  • One of those individuals was my older sister.
  • Because of our efforts, the city has asked the org. to help promote the testing and education program in the City of Shreveport.

Risks & Challenges

  • Quality of life. By having to go to dialysis 3 times a week, it affects my quality of life, 
  • By receiving the transplant I can become a functioning member of society, and help others learn the value of being aware and being tested. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Who We Are

Merrill Hutchinson M.Ed, NSCA-CPT
Merrill has been working as a High School Science Teacher, Counselor, and Coach for the past 28 years. While teaching, his favorite subjects were Anatomy and Physiology. His favorite aspects of coaching have always centered around strength and conditioning in wrestling, swimming, and track and field. Along with teaching and coaching, Merrill has spent over 16 of the 28 years as a School Counselor. His desire to work with others in the areas of teaching, coaching, and counseling has been the driving force in his professional career. Outside of his career, Merrill has always been interested in exercise and fitness. He has spent countless hours riding bikes, running, swimming, lifting weights, and more. He loves sunshine and being outside, and as his family will attest, if he ever has a free moment, you will probably see him trying to squeeze in a workout.

Linda Hutchinson M.A.
Linda was a collegiate volleyball player at Northern Kentucky University and spent the early years of her career as a Jr High teacher and varsity volleyball coach.  Linda wishes she had had a piece of equipment like the Finisher when she played and coached.  It would have been an invaluable asset to her strength and conditioning program. In 1999 Linda took a full time ministry position in SE Indiana where she still works today as the Family Life Director.  Linda holds a BA in Secondary Education and a Masters in Pastoral Counseling.  Linda loves teaching, coaching, and counseling and is passionate about helping people live life to the fullest.

Family
Merrill and Linda have been married for over 27 years and have two adult sons.  Nick, a US Naval Academy grad, and his wife Lane live in San Diego, California where he is in training with the Navy Special Forces.  Zach is currently a college junior studying Mechanical Engineering through the Naval ROTC Program at Miami. University. Merrill and Linda both believe in God's amazing grace and feel extremely blessed with the family and good fortune they have had.



Our Campaign

Make no mistake about it, we need your help and support! The last two years have been all about developing, teaching, refining, and researching. From all that work, we believe now more than ever that we have a first class product and process. Finishing continues to prove itself to be revolutionary in its effectiveness for all people. Whether the pro athlete or the senior citizen, Finishing will help you achieve your strength and fitness goals.

1. We need your support to help us get Finishing out to the market. First and foremost, we need you to spread the word. Talk, demonstrate, social media, if you believe in Finishing, then help us by spreading the word.
2. Yes, we need money. The past two years have been costly, but necessary in order to establish the product and process of Finishing. Now we need money to help us with Marketing, Sales, Inventory, Certification Training, Trade Shows, Advertising, and General Business Expenditures.

What You Get in Return!
1. First...A Huge Thank You! We appreciate all the support we can get and realize that Finishing goes nowhere without YOU!
2. A Gift of Appreciation! For each level of giving the giver will receive a gift or reward for their support. The Gifting Spectrum Follows:
Level 1 $10.00 = Thank You
Level 2 $50.00 = The Finisher Workout Shirt
Level 3 $75.00 = The Finisher Workout Shirt + 2 Classes
Level 4 $100.00 = The Finisher Workout Shirt + 4 Classes
Level 5 $200.00 = The Finisher Workout Shirt + 10 Classes
Level 6 $300.00 = The Finisher Workout Shirt + Certification or Workout Videos
Level 7 $400.00 = The Finisher Workout Shirt + Workout Videos + Portable Finisher Workout Mat

Level 8 $650.00 = The Finisher Workout Shirt + Finisher Home Model + Workout Videos
Level 9 $850.00 = The Finisher Workout Shirt + Finisher Home Model + Workout Videos + 10 Classes



Level 10 $1200.00 = The Finisher Workout Shirt + Finisher Commercial Model + Workout Videos + 10 Classes



Funding Goal and Purpose
First Goal: $2000.00
Purpose: Develop and Launch our Finishing Certification Program.

Second Goal: $5000.00
Purpose: All the Above + Purchase and Build the necessary equipment to expand our Finishing Classes into at least two more locations

Third Goal: $10,000.00
Purpose: All the Above + Pay Fees for Fitness and Therapy Trade Shows. 1. Professional Baseball Strength Coaches Association Winter Training. 2. National Strength and Conditioning Conference. 3. The Fit Expo.

Fourth Goal: $15,000.00
Purpose: All The Above + Hire Marketing and Advertising to help us focus our word and get it out to the intended markets. + Produce necessary inventory for growth. + Expand the number of classes.

Fifth Goal: $20,000.00 
Purpose: All The Above + Pay down some of initial debt

Sixth Goal: $30,000.00
Purpose: All The Above + Development of a Finisher that is lighter and more functional for storage and transportation.

Seventh Goal: $40,000.00
Purpose: All the Above + Expand our Certification program to get more trainers in more locations.

Eighth Goal: $50,000.00+
Purpose: All the Above + Work to promote Finishing to all regions of the country through Trade Shows and Training Opportunities.

Why do We Believe in Finishing and Why Should You?
Proof! Yes, it is that simple. The only reason that Finishing began is because it quickly began showing me results. After losing the use of my left arm from C5 Palsy, I was serious about finding something to help. Finishing was a large component of my success in the healing process. Since that time we have seen the research produce incredible numbers of improvement among the participants.

So what's so different about Finishing compared to other workouts?
Finishing is proving itself to be revolutionary in terms of how we view exercise and workouts. Let's be clear, fitness and health is not about one magic pill, diet, workout, or piece of equipment. Health and fitness comes from a combination of things that develop into our lifestyle and habits. When it comes to fitness you have two main areas that people go to, cardio or resistance training. i.e. running or lifting weights. Finishing is unique in that it safely develops the user by working the entire body through a combination of both cardio and resistance training in the same functional workout. 

Here are the key points.
1. Entire Body - unlike running or cycling or even swimming, Finishing works the entire body; legs, hips, back, abs, chest, arms, and shoulders. Working the body in a full range of motion to develop strength, endurance and flexibility.
2. Cardio - because we are working through timed intervals, there is no planned time for rest in the middle of the workout. You are in motion the entire time. The overall quality of the Cardio benefit is directly related to the intensity of the workout. You decide.
3. Resistance Training - Because we are sliding a weight across a surface, we experience resistance. That resistance places a load on the body that the body must build itself in order to meet and successfully overcome in order to perform the motion.
4. Functional Workout - This has been a key trait of Finishing. Our motions and exercises are using the body in the same way you would use your body in your daily activities. Whether it's swinging a golf club or picking something up from the ground. We teach the body to understand how to move and then strengthen the body to move efficiently and effectively.
5. Safely - Yes, I have seen and done other workouts that will make similar claims, the one that first comes to mind is Crossfit. Don't get me wrong I love to workout and love a challenge, and even love doing various aspects of these workouts, but the number of people that I have seen or read about that are getting hurt from the "functional" movement exercises performed during their "workout of the day" is staggering. The problem is often due to poor form, excessive intensity, or simply doing moves that your body cannot support without leaving them susceptible to getting injured.

We honestly believe that Finishing will become a form of exercise seen throughout the industry. We believe this because when something is good, people want it and will support it. Plain and simple, Finishing is Good!
As stated earlier, we need your help. More than anything else we need you to help us spread the word!

story:
What is X-Treme Vending?

The core purpose of X-Treme Vending is to serve as a nutritional vending service, conveniently located in all participating locations in your community.  Our vending machines provide everyday health enthusiasts with convenient access to their dietary and nutritional supplement needs as well as allow them to be the first to try new products in the nutritional market. 

These products include: 

  • Healthy perishables
  • Protein shakes
  • Vitamins
  • Pre-workouts
  • Post-workouts
  • and many other nutritional items


The Need!

Due to the fast-pace environment that we live in, many individuals go throughout their day without the nutrients their bodies need and have no choice but to purchase the unhealthy alternatives that our current convenient stores and vending machines offer. 

With X-Treme Vending, this is no longer the case. Our community will now have quick access to healthy wraps, salads, sports drinks, vitamins, energy drinks, and the list goes on. These items will allow everyone to have on-the-go-access to the  necessary items that will get them through the day.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us fund our campaign by getting the word out, you can use the share tools listed!

story:
Haiti Village Health is a volunteer based, non-profit, non-governmental registered charity providing sustainable primary health care and training to the people of the under-serviced rural region of Bas Limbe in northern Haiti.

In May, I will be travelling to Haiti for the second time to work with HVH.

Your donation will go towards the funding of volunteers, medical clinics, medical supplies, training of Haitian medical staff, and other health based initiatives in the region, including clean water an hygiene projects.

Your donation will go towards the funding of volunteers, medical clinics, medical supplies, training of Haitian medical staff, and other health based initiatives in the region, including clean water an hygiene projects.

story:
Picture a Cure

With the help of the University of Michigan Health Services my team and I are putting together a fundraiser called 'Picture a Cure'. Picture a Cure is a new charity that we are starting where 100% of funds earned are donated to Colon Cancer research (UMHS) and the American Cancer Association. In 2007, my mother passed of Colon Cancer and I wanted to find a unique way to give back. She was my biggest fan and always the first to push me in pursuit of my passions. I thought to myself,  "What better way to give back than to have a fundraiser where I can join both efforts?"

We are excited to host the first annual Picture a Cure fundraiser where both
adults and children will be entertained. We will have 6 photo stations where
families can have portraits taken by some of the best photographers Michigan
has to offer. Attendees are able to print their photos on location or download
them from the event website.

Why

Of cancers, colorectal cancer is one of the top three leading causes of cancer related deaths in the United States. Most colon cancers develop from polyps that become cancerous if not recognized early and removed.

We are here to help change that. We are raising money to fund research for cures and treatments for colon cancer. Every penny raised or donated by you goes directly into funding research, so help us get one step closer today.

  • 100 % percent of all funds raised will be donated to The University of Michigan Cancer Center and Colon Cancer Alliance.

story:
Reason & Goal


My name is Anna Taylor.  My mom is the most influential, strong, creative, and caring woman that I've ever met.  Last December she was diagnosed with breast cancer.  She took the most dramatic approach to fighting this by getting a double mastectomy on January 21st.  During surgery, cancer was found in the sentinel lymph node.  Though she has not had her PET scan yet, the doctors are sure that it has spread elsewhere.  She will now have to undergo four months of intensive chemo. 

She has kept a pretty positive attitude throughout this process.  Luckily, she has an amazing support system filled with friends and family. 

Unfortunately, though she has good insurance, the expenses are piling up.  Due to my family's current economic situation, she will have to continue working throughout chemo. 

My goal is to have her working the least amount possible, or at least to cover some of the medical expenses.  I want to try to keep her mind stress-free in spite of the circumstances. 

Details

The medical expenses after insurance are up to about $8,000. 

ANY amount will help. 


Other Ways You Can Help

This is something that my mom posted to FaceBook a short time after she was diagnosed...please read/share...

"Some of you might question why I'm posting this but it is for one reason and one reason only - I have a mission given my recent circumstances. On December 20th I was told I have breast cancer. The only reason the cancer was found - and found early - is because I had my annual mammogram. I am taking an aggressive approach to this and have every reason to believe I will be cancer-free soon.
I feel it is my responsibility to spread the word that mammograms save lives. Please schedule yours soon!"

Also...

She has no idea that I'm doing this.  She's tough and wouldn't want to seem to be asking for charity.  I'd prefer she didn't know until later on. 


THANK YOU

story:
Cruisin’ for Kids

Benefiting

                Children's Hospital & Research Center Oakland

       

Help the Northern CA Fleet of the Classic Yacht Association, in partnership with the USS Potomac, take twenty-five patients and their families from the Children's Hospital & Research Center Oakland, for a History Cruise on the Bay.  The patients and their families will be aboard the Potomac, escorted by ten classic yachts carrying over a hundred Hospital staff, VIP’s and friends.

The cruise is scheduled for Saturday, October 19, 2013.  The event will provide relief to the families from their daily concerns in addition to supporting the Foundation.  This is our first Cruisin' for Kids and with your support, we hope to make it an annual event.

Our Organization and Team

The Classic Yacht Association was founded in 1971 and is dedicated to the promotion, preservation, restoration, and maintenance of fine, old, power driven pleasure craft.  Our Northern California Fleet has about sixty classic vessel members and operates on a budget of only a few thousand dollars per year and this project far exceeds our financial resources.  We've managed to keep the overall costs to a minimum with companies supplying escort craft, security, parking, docents, and other support functions at no cost.

 In addition to preserving the heritage of FDR's yacht, Potomac provides educational and history cruises for hundreds of Oakland public school children every year.  Marti Burchell is the Executive Director. Our Fleet officers are: John Di Lillo - Commodore, George Homenko - Vice Commodore, Susan Takami - Rear Commodore, Les Cochren - Staff Commodore, and Shawn Ball - Intl. Vice Commodore. Visit us at http://www.classicyacht.org

The Cruise

We will be leaving the Jack London Square docks at 10:30 for a two and a half hour cruise.  This will be a large fleet of thirteen boats with Oakland PD providing Pilot and Chase vessels.  We will take the kids under the new eastern span of the Bay Bridge, around Angel Island up to the Golden Gate, down along the San Francisco waterfront, then under the western span of the Bay Bridge, and then back to Jack London Square.  We'll have caterers serving lunch, photographers taking their pictures, docents to help with wheel chairs, and hospital staff available if needed.  Additionally the kids will be presented with event watch caps and burgees to take home.

It should be an exciting experience for the kids and their families.  With your support we can make a difference. 

the CYA NC Fleet Commodore at nccommodore@classicyacht.org.

story:
What It's About

Hey everyone! My name is Beenie. I'm teaming up with Princess Hair Shop, a primarily online hair extensions company, to raise money for Susan G. Komen for the Cure. Our goal is $1,000. Like so many others, I have had family members and friends that have been impacted by breast cancer. Witnessing those close to me battle breast cancer and seeing the physical changes being just an indication of the struggles and pains they are dealing with has made me so appreciative of all of the small things I have in my life. One of those small things that I've become so appreciative of is my hair. My hair is currently 31" long, something not many people can say. However, I am ready to chop it all off and donate it to Locks of Love.

When my friend lost her hair during her fight, she always joked about how I should cut my hair for her. I wasn't joking when I said I would. It seems like such a small thing, but growing up as the kid that had the ridiculously long hair, I know the sense of identity something as simple as hair can bring.

Here's the breakdown. I'll cut around 15 inches of my hair off and donate it to Locks of Love if the fundraising goal of $1,000 for Komen for the Cure is met. In return you'll get to see what I'd look like with short hair (which you totally care about...right?) and a feeling of amazingness. Also I'll send you a picture of Nic Cage, by request. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! If you don't want to donate here, you can always support the cause by donating on the Susan G. Komen website, donating your hair to Locks of Love, or on many other websites. Also, Race for the Cure is coming up soon! Make sure you sign up! I'll see you there :)

One of those small things that I've become so appreciative of is my hair. My hair is currently 31" long, something not many people can say. However, I am ready to chop it all off and donate it to Locks of Love.
When my friend lost her hair during her fight, she always joked about how I should cut my hair for her. I wasn't joking when I said I would. It seems like such a small thing, but growing up as the kid that had the ridiculously long hair, I know the sense of identity something as simple as hair can bring.
Here's the breakdown. I'll cut around 15 inches of my hair off and donate it to Locks of Love if the fundraising goal of $1,000 for Komen for the Cure is met. In return you'll get to see what I'd look like with short hair (which you totally care about...right?) and a feeling of amazingness. Also I'll send you a picture of Nic Cage, by request. 
Other Ways You Can Help
Spread the word! If you don't want to donate here, you can always support the cause by donating on the Susan G. Komen website, donating your hair to Locks of Love, or on many other websites. Also, Race for the Cure is coming up soon! Make sure you sign up! I'll see you there :)

story:
Who are we?

We are Airborn Academy, an internationally recognised, professional Freerunning and Parkour group who are completely passionate about this breathtaking innovation of movement. We have successfully delivered a wide range of Freerunning and Parkour projects in Merseyside and throughout the UK and currently offer coached classes, freestyle sessions, workshops and demonstrations across all age ranges, abilities and skill levels.

Coaches and workshops: http://youtu.be/tR0VM_oGDvs


We are eager to share our enthusiasm and coaching experience to encourage our communities to get involved in this exceptional discipline and experience the positive impact it can have on wellbeing, both physically and mentally.

The time is right for us to flip to the next chapter of the Airborn story and help shape the future of Freerunning and Parkour ...

So, what's next?

Our vision is to open a state of the art, purpose built, urban sports centre called the ‘Airborn Academy’. This will primarily focus on the training and development of Freerunning and Parkour within a safe but completely unique and exciting environment, but will also offer a multitude of other urban sports classes including tricking, trampolining, cheerleading, martial arts, breaking and other urban dance, gymnastics and aerial skills.

After over a year of searching and hard work getting our plans together, we now have the ideal venue ... next, we need to create the perfect facility including a sprung floor, tumble tracks, crazy obstacles, and inspiring bar and multi-levelled areas.

What we need ...

In this pitch we are asking for £17,000 for two major pieces of equipment for the Airborn Academy: 

*   £10,000 for the state of the art, bespoke designed foam pit 

*   £7,000 for the 8 metre long fast track 

The foam pit is awesome and a central piece in the design layout of the Airborn Academy. It is essential for teaching safe landing of Freerunning and gymnastics movements and is also a lot of fun!

The fast track is a trampoline-based run up leading into the pit and is a vital piece of equipment allowing students to safely practice and develop their skills; from complete beginners to the advanced athletes. It reduces impact on joints, assists in learning new movements and helps develop confidence. 

What are the benefits to the community?

Those who try it really engage in Freerunning and Parkour, especially young people who may not connect with the usual mainstream sports offered in schools. They have a lot of fun mastering skills and movement they would not have thought themselves capable of, in a non-competitive environment, plus there are the huge benefits participating in this activity also brings:

Improves health and wellbeing.

Increases engagement in sports and urban arts especially in the youth.

Diverts anti-social behaviour within teenagers and young adults towards positive activities, which will in turn benefit and improve the local communities and neighbourhoods. 

Increases confidence and self esteem.

Inclusion in the community; this activity really promotes a sense of family and belonging amongst the students.

Offers possible opportunities to participate in displays, events, television and online media.

When will the Airborn Academy open?

We will open our doors in 2013 to develop and support the urban sports culture and provide a venue for our students to use the freedom of movement and their imagination to get creative and progress their skills and talents in their chosen disciplines.

We hope you are excited as we are about this worthwhile project ... please check out the links to our website and YouTube media below to give you further information about the Airborn Academy and what we are all about.

Be inspired and get involved!

ITV Granada Reports: 

www.airbornacademy.com

Risks and challenges

We are hoping to open up the centre in October 2013 in the Liverpool City Centre.

Needless to say this is reliant on us building and creating the perfect facility, including sprung floor, tumble tracks, crazy obstacles and inspiring levelled areas!

So far the planners and the council are on board .... so fingers crossed! :)

ROSTERS ARE UP


Team 1 

Grace Goro, Lauren Pagone, Trish O'Donnell, Katie Seiwert, Alex Kuzel, Avery Connelly, KC Kaage, Pat O'Malley, Jimmy Coy, Kevin Boggs, Robbie Bosco, Sam Zeller

Team 3

Team 5

Team 6 

Tim Seiwert, John Schreiner, Dave Schreiner, Adam Palumbo, Frank Palumbo, Chad Pahnke, Hillary Palumbo, Brittany Palumbo, Jenna Williams, Jessica Baer


Team 7 

Colin O'Malley, Andy Simkins, Mark Sagerstrom, Sean Price, Kris Krisko, Michael Madsen, Matt Kennedy, Aly Marchetti, Veronica Marchetti, Brianna Liebling


Team 8

Catherine MaloneyMary Kate McDonnell, Annie Hartmann, Caroline Skender, Jeff Skender, Jackie Hart, Erin Vondrasek, Sam Winegardner, Daniela Giacalone, Packy Doyle, David Leach


Team 9

Mark Mathieson, George Day, Joey Jankowski, Bob Danielson, Roger Redmen, Natalie Rush, Nikki Fulton, Ali Lince, Shannon Hilton, Logan White, Steph Foreman


Team 10

Captain Akos Straub, Roster Coming Soon...




OUR STORY

13 Years Ago...

Our dad was diagnosed with stage four Prostate Cancer. 

He had gone in for a random checkup when they found it. He had no symptoms. There was no warning. He was only fifty years old.

The doctors told him if he didn't begin treatment immediately, he would not survive another six months.

That was 13 years ago.

Thanks to a last-minute detection, his doctors and the research that went into developing the cutting-edge treatments that saved his life, our dad is still with us today. 

But for thousands of families across the country, the journey is just beginning:

  • The American Cancer Society has predicted that about 238,590 new cases of Prostate Cancer will be diagnosed this year. About 29,720 men will die of Prostate Cancer.
  • It is the second most common, and second most fatal, cancer in men in the United States.
  • 1 man in 6 will be diagnosed with Prostate Cancer in his lifetime.

1 in 6. 

It's time to get tough on Prostate Cancer. 

The BlueZone and the Prostate Cancer Foundation of Chicago

The BlueZone is a Goro family organization dedicated to raising funds and awareness to aid in the fight against Prostate Cancer. This year, we'll be hosting our first annual PCL (Prostate Cancer League) BlueZone Kickoff Classic on the football fields of Lincoln Park between Montrose and Wilson. Any and all proceeds will go to benefit the Prostate Cancer Foundation of Chicago.

The Tournament - November 16, 2013 

7 on 7, co-ed flag football. 

10 players per team, 12 player max. There MUST be 3 girls on the field at all times. No exceptions. (That's on the field, not on the sidelines.) 

Two rounds of pool play and then bracket play. Each team is guaranteed at least three games.

Two, ten-minute halves per game with a five-minute halftime.

$250 entry fee per team. Captains, sign up your teams. First come, first serve so don't wait to sign up!

Donations and Sponsors

Sponsors

Sponsors will have their company, business or family name printed on the back of the 200+ event shirts. Event sponsors will also have their company, business or family name on banners at the November 16 event.

Donations

We believe that together we can make a difference. Whether you choose one of our preset 'perks' or enter in your own contribution, any little bit helps! Thank you!

Post-Game Party

We would like to give a special thank you to Glascott's for offering to host our post-game party. 

Glascott's Saloon - 2158 N. Halsted

4:00pm - 7:00pm

$30 wristbands: Unlimited domestics and call liquor.

A portion of the proceeds from each wristband will go to benefit the Prostate Cancer Foundation of Chicago as well.

story:
FLEXBUNDLE.COM

Note: If your perk includes a tank top pick one from the gallery

The Supplements You Want At The Prices You Want!

Who We Are & What We Want To Do

The Service

Have you ever wanted to buy supplements without the hassle of the big stores, like GNC, with their car salesman-like employees and high prices? Or, do you buy the cheap stuff at Wal-mart and want to try something higher quality at a still low price? Or are you just looking for a more convenient solution? FlexBundle.com is an online subscription service we created to deliver sports nutrition supplements to more mainstream fitness advocates who want convenience, great deals, and quality without the hassle of stores and the confusing multitude of options. We see this industry as one that is growing; in 2012 alone the vitamin, mineral, and supplement category generated $32 billion in revenue and Forbes listed it as one of the fastest growing industries. The online sale of these products isn't new, but for sport enthusiasts the current solutions are too cluttered and geared towards hardcore users. We want to help more maintstream people find the product types that suit their bodies and goals and then allow them to receive them automatically every month.

The Team

Our small team of web developers and fitness enthusiasts, the creators of FlexBundle.com, are led by brothers Justin and Trevor. Young and enthusiastic, both have a combined 14 years of experience in web development and several years as gym-goers and nutrition enthusiasts. Starting out young in the web development game, both of us began competing in high school as members of Business Professionals of America in the web competitions. This gave of a strong foundation in commercial web creation, competition, and lit the entrepreneurial spirit within. Following our high school years, we sharpened our skills working for web development firms, computer science research institutes in college, and by completing many websites and mobile apps for local businesses and organizations. Besides our interest in web, we both love the fitness and nutrition science, culture, and practice. By learning about supplementation and exercise from books, blogs, and many other sources, we were able to harden our once soft, squishy bodies and lead healthier lives.

What We Need To Continue

As development of this service is nearly complete, we need your assistance to get us off the ground. We've done the work build the service but we need to buy an initial stock of products. We limit our variety to only quality, inexpesive versions of each product type, making it easier on beginner and intermediate gym-goers. We need approximately $3,000 to buy our initial stock of products, including all product types and flavors in appropriate initial quantities. Here are the products we plan on carrying initially:

Some of Our Products

Whey Protein: Vanilla, Strawberry, and chocolate of course

Whey Isolate: Same flavors as regular whey

Fish oil

 

Vitamins for men

 

Vitamins for women

 

Creatine


For a complete list of products and all of their relavent information, please visit: http://flexbundle.com/products

We also need $5,000 to cover transaction processing, server setup and maintainence, SEO, marketing, and other tech-related costs. This project will be the push our startup needs to get rolling.

Technical / Marketing Costs

Expense

Amount
Scalable Hosting (server) ~$500.00 (1 year)
Finish Development (site, SEO, and other) $2,000
Marketing  
Targeted Internet Marketing ~$1,000 (1 month long campaign)
Merchandise (apparel and such for gyms) $750
In-gym marketing (print material) $500
Misc. $250
Total $5,000

The Impact

The impact of this campaign is monumental for us. It essentially gives the rocket we've built the fuel to deliver the goods to the universe of future clients out there. If successfully funded, the launch of this service will provide fitness enthusiasts a way to better manage their supplementation, learn about products, and save money in the process. We believe that our service will help foster dedication to fitness and health.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't or can't contribute monetarily to our project, please share us with your friends. If you are an athlete, bodybuilder, weekend warrior, or just interested in starting a fitness program, please check us out at http://flexbundle.com and sign up. When we launch officially, we will email you so you may enter your billing and shipping information to start receiving your product bundle.

story:
Ongoing work is needed at the GGP Disc Golf Course

  • We need tier work on #11/#16
  • Removing Trash from Trash cans on all Holes
  • Finish the great wall on #6.
  • Add Drain rock to all the tees in need
  • There are more tee signs to be replaced
  • constant maintenance due to ever-increasing foot traffic as daily new disc golfers explore their obsession
  • the necessarily vigilant watch over erosion spots on the course

What we need:

Support through funding to keep the workers on the course part/full-time, providing for and serving the rapidly growing disc golf community in San Francisco and the greater Northern California region.

Through their tireless work and dedication, the Golden Gate Park Disc Golf Course will be the premiere free public course in the United States and the standard by which all other courses, private and public, will be judged in the future.

We've made great strides!

Planting grass in numerous locations to stop and control Erosion on our sand based course.

Purchased a truck to use for hauling and course maintainence, its already earned its place in the SFDGC Fam.

Erosion control on pathway on Hole 12

Drain rock placed around teepads #11 and #12 to stop flooding and mud tees.

The TEMPLE structure on Hole #11

The "Great Wall" on hole #6

Improved teebox area on #12

Drastically reduced play-through times on 11,12,14 with proper maintenance of the hill side.That is now covered in GRASS!!!

New Tee Signs!

More seating!

Erosion control tier on 18 to save main tree by the C pin.

...and last but certainly not least the course is continuing to get more GREEN!

story:
Short Summary

Our father Jan Balch was diagnosed with lung cancer metastasized to his spine, brain, bones and adrenal glands.  

Sadly his battle was short, he passed February 9th, 2013 at Glens Falls  Hospital.   

He had no insurance and little funds in his accounts.

My brother and I never have been the type to ask for help. but this time it is greatly needed.

Your contributions with help us pay for:

The Funeral

A nice foot stone for our Dad

Bills, attorneys fees

House repairs (major work is needed)

 

Any help you can give would be greatly appreciated.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Forward on to any freinds and family that may be able to help.

We are most gracious in this hard time.

 

Check donations can be made to:

“In Memory of Jan Balch”
Maynard D. Baker Funeral Home 
11 Lafayette Street, Queensbury, NY

Thank you <3

story:
Once upon a time, children and adults with physical disabilities like spina bifida or multiple sclerosis were not expected to live long or healthy lives. Today, this could not be farther from the truth. People with physical disabilities can grow to have active and fulfilling lives well into adulthood – lives that are improved and lengthened by physical exercise.

For almost 30 years, the Greater Oklahoma Disabled Sports Association has been helping children and adults with physical disabilities become confident and competitive athletes. One of our most popular and beneficial sporting events is wheelchair basketball. These games offer disabled athletes the opportunity to compete in tournaments at state and national levels, or even make it to the Paralympics! In addition, friendships and memories that last a lifetime are forged between players.

Specialized sporting equipment is of paramount importance to keep our athletes at the top of their game. We currently are asking for assistance in purchasing wheelchairs for both our children and our adult players. With your help, disabled athletes of any age will have the opportunity to strengthen bonds with others and develop the physical fitness needed to remain healthy and competitive.

Wheelchairs for these athletes are not covered by medical insurance providers, but with your help, this equipment will enable disabled competitors to build tremendous self-esteem, a sense of camaraderie with their peers, and longer lives. Thank you for your consideration!

story:
Broad Street Maps

We make maps that improve the delivery of healthcare to people in need. Working collaboratively with our NGO customers, we produce maps and data graphics designed to reflect the ground truth of the people they serve, help track and improve operations and reveal strategic opportunities. Our mission includes training in order to leave behind basic GPS skills for capturing vital data, so the maps can adapt dynamically with the needs of our customers and the people they serve.

broadstreetmaps.org

Our two team members graduated from Middlebury College, where we both majored in Geography and minored in global health. While at Middlebury, we were both struck by the potential of mapping to improve public health. Maps, we realized, are an easy tool for understanding the scope and scale of a problem, for planning the best interventions to address that problem, and for communicating the efficiency of an intervention to others. With this in mind, we recently launched Broad Street Maps, a consulting service that helps small health organizations improve their services by "putting patients on the map."

What we do

More specifically, Broad Street Maps equips grassroots health organizations with open-source mapping techniques to visualize and improve their services.  Maps provide the visualization and context to make sense of often incomprehensible data. We aim to support small health organizations by designing and implementing individualized mapping projects. By collecting spatial data using a GPS and combining it with existing health information to produce maps, organizations can illustrate the geographic distribution of the problems they seek to address, bringing better services to where they're needed most.

Our project in Peru

After a successful first project with Gardens for Health, International (http://gardensforhealth.org) in Rwanda in the summer of 2012, we are traveling to Peru on March 1st to complete a project with a small organization called Sacred Valley Health (www.sacredvalleyhealth.org). While the project with Gardens for Health focused on mapping cases of malnutrition, the project with Sacred Valley Health is aimed at getting a better picture of where tuberculosis and diarrheal cases are most prevalent. The maps that we make with Sacred Valley Health will enable the organization to better understand where the hotspots of disease are so that they can maximize their limited resources and manpower and get treatment to their most vulnerable patients.

Looking ahead:

After Peru, we have office space in the North End of Boston. Our efforts will be spent primarily on pursuing new clients. Additionally, we will focus on developing more comprehensive training materials and project evaluation strategies. 

Where will the money go?

The money we raise in the first stage we will use to cover start-up costs and prepare for May, when we will have completed the field work for our Peru-based client, and will establish our base of operations as a hybrid organization (both a 501C3 organization and an LLC) in a social enterprise incubator in Boston. 

$5000: Business costs, including office space, software (e.g. Adobe Suite), and computers.

$5000: Operational expenses for the first six-months

We intend to raise additional funds through grants, building on the success we have had in securing grants for our work in 2012, and we have applications under consideration. By early 2014, our plan calls for balancing the sources of capital with roughly 40% coming from grants, 40% coming from fees paid by our clients, and 20% from founding investors.

Other ways that you can help...

Broad Street Maps is not just looking for funding, we need your support and connections too! Know any health organizations that might be interested in our services? Send them our way...

Additional Resources

Our blog: http://broadstreetmaps.org/broad-street-maps-1/ 

Middlebury Magazine Article: http://blogs.middlebury.edu/middmag/2012/11/02/making-change/

Digital Health Revoltution Panel at UVM medical school (skip to minute 50 to see us): http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7Om8t2vS_WI&feature=plcp

story:
Short Summary

Hi friends and family.  As many of you know I am a former military pilot.  Flying has been a passion of mine since I was a small child.  Thankfully I was able to achieve my childhood dream of growing up and serving as a U.S. Air Force pilot.  

Aside from the missions I flew while in the Air Force, this cause presents the first time I am able to do good and utilize my flying and talents to benefit others.  I feel very fortunate for some basic things that are easiliy taken for granted at times--health, education, opportunity, etc.  The kids that I am flying with have not been as fortunate.  

 

What We Need & What You Get

Flying isn't cheap.  It will cost me roughly $140 per hour to opperate the aircraft.  With an expected total of four (4) flying hours, that comes to $560.  I plan to fly as many kids as I can in this projected time frame.  

I'd gladly pay it all myself, but obviously there are reasons I am here seeking your assistance.  

The Impact

Builds self-esteem and confidence of children and youth with specials needs, through the experience of flight.  Can you imagine how excited these kids will be to have this opportunity?!

Other Ways You Can Help

Hey, if you can't help out on the financial end...I simply ask that you help me in my efforts by sharing this fundraising request with your friends and family.

story:
The fight for freedom (06-29-2012)

 

 

 

MMS Targeted - US~Observer reports:
usobserver.com/archive/may-12/MMS-targeted.htm

 

 

 

I have asked all supporters of MMS and the Genesis II Church to send donations to the US~Observer to support their efforts in establishing a defense team for Daniel Smith and others within the MMS movement, if needed. They are also in the process of defending MMS itself against the FDA.

 

 We need a minimum of 2 million dollars to make the plan work that we established with the US~Observer when we first obtained their invaluable help. Thus far, we have raised just over $50,000.

 

 Thank you for being concerned and intelligent. Thank you for realizing, as I do, that we might never have another opportunity like the one we now have in regaining our health freedoms and having control over our personal health choices.

 

 The US~Observer is deep into their investigation of MMS. They have already began obtaining clinical proof of the benefits of MMS and they have just published their first edition covering our issues like no other news source could, and it is currently being circulated around the globe.

 

 Now we all need to role up our sleeves and finish this mission that we started. If you haven´t donated then please do so. If you have donated - please do so again, if possible.

 

 Then become a fund-raising warrior! Talk to your friends and family. Seek out like-minded individuals who are equally concerned with preserving our rights regarding our personal health issues and treatments and ask them to donate.

 

 Seek out other groups interested in fighting the FDA, like local farmers, naturopaths, health food store owners, etc., and get them involved. Just think if every health food store had a FDAcollection box - donations would come pouring in!

 

 While it takes money to fund this, it isn't only about dollars. It is about action. And, the US~Observer has just thrown their first punch which is being felt worldwide. Let us thank them by showing that we can provide the funding for them to finish this historic battle that they are fully capable of winning.

 

 I am so impressed with the US~Observer and I am equally as impressed with all of you fine people.

 

 

 

Let's finish what we started.
Archbishop Jim Humble

 

P.S.
Go to US Observer to see what has been going on!

 

 

 

DONATE NOW

 

 

 

Donations may also be sent to:

 

MMS Defense Fund
c/o US~Observer
233 Rogue River HWY PMB #387
Grants Pass, OR 97527

 

 

 

The US~Observer has taken on this fight and published an initial article. You can read it here. If you haven't already, please read the urgent plea I previously sent out. You can read it here.

 

 

As always with love,
Archbishop Jim Humble

jimhumble.biz/files/Basic_Science_of_MMS_Chlorine_Dioxide.doc

MMS Testimonials:
genesis2church.org/mms-testimonials.html

MMS Video Testimonials:
youtube.com/MMStestimonials

 

If you haven't already, please read the urgent plea I (Jim Humble) previously sent out. You can read it here.

 

Contribute today and help us stop the FDA.

 

 

Donations may also be sent to:

 

MMS Defense Fund
c/o US~Observer
233 Rogue River HWY PMB #387
Grants Pass, OR 97527

 

Donate directly through PayPal:
paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=YRYUZQ9MB3X7W

 

The FDA blocks healthy options and prosecutes their promoters:
usobserver.com/archive/may-12/MMS-targeted.htm

MMS CAN NOW FIGHT THE FDA THANKS TO YOUR EMAILS 05-16-2012:
mmsnews.org/all-newsletters/112-mms-can-now-fight-the-fda-thanks-to-your-emails-05-16-2012.html

Daniel In The Lions Den (05-07-2012):
mmsnews.org/all-newsletters/110-daniel-in-the-lions-den-05-07-2012.html

MMS on Trial : Grand Jury to Determine the Fate of Daniel Smith (and MMS):
mmsnews.org/all-newsletters/109-mms-on-trial-grand-jury-to-determine-the-fate-of-daniel-smith-and-mms-2.html

Daniel's website:
iAmNotAnAnimal.org

story:
More than a month after chemicals seeped into West Virginia's biggest water supply, residents of nine counties would rather bundle up, drive to one of a parking lots in the area (sometimes and hour away) and fill jugs of water from the spigot of a tanker truck. They can't trust the water they are getting from their taps at home  and they can't trust the messages they are receiving from officials.

This is the new normal routine for many and the routine must be performed around three times a week, a necessary burden to feel safe drinking water, cooking with it and making coffee. It's a terrible inconvenience and health risk that should not be happening.

The Elk River chemical spill occurred on January 9, 2014 when crude 4-methylcyclohexanemethanol (MCHM) was released from a Freedom Industries facility into the Elk River, a tributary of the Kanawha River, in Charleston, WV.

The chemical spill occurred upstream from the principal West Virginia American Water intake and treatment and distribution center. Following the spill, up to 300,000 residents within nine counties in the Charleston, West Virginia metropolitan area were without access to potable water. The areas affected were portions of Boone, Clay, Jackson, Kanawha, Lincoln, Logan, Putnam, and Roane counties and the Culloden area of Cabell County.

As a show of community support and humanitarian air, the good people at Flavor Living Radio, are hosting a fundraiser for Bulk Water for Charleston, WV.

Flavor Living Radio loves to share with you all the fantastic food facts from around the globe but Our Radio Show is also on a mission, a mission to do more for the people in need. Flavor Living Radio wants to help.  We are holding a fund raising drive “Food for thought” to raise money to  sending bulk bottled water to the people there in the Charleston area that still need it.  Please click on the above image “Food for thought” to help with this the cause and make a donation to send bulk bottles of water to to the good people of  Charleston, West Virginia.

story:
Whats All This About?

Hello I am a 35 year old couch potato trying to do something special in 2014.  That special deed will be whipping myself into shape to complete 260 miles worth of endurance events to raise money for Kenzie, an amazing little boy.  The programme will involve distance running, road cycling, swimming and Triathlons to raise money in support of Kenzie’s Wish Fund.

Kenzies Wish

At the age of 6 weeks old Kenzie started to develop eating dissorders which meant he has to be fed through a tube down his nose.  Kenzie is waiting for a gastrostamy (a tube into his tummy) along with another operation

for oesophageal reflux where his doctor will wrap his stomach

around the oesophagus tubes.

Kenzie is under a number of specialist doctors who believe he may also have  suspected Angelman Syndrome, Autism and is an Albino which means he has visual impairment.

Kenzie also has communication difficulties and recently, has also been diagnosed with severe scoliosis which means he has a curve

on his upper and lower spine which causes distortion in muscles and the ribs.

Kenzie cannot stand unaided without specialist equipment that he has had to borrow.

Kenzie’s Wish Fund has been started with a wide range of events raising invaluable funds to help towards specialist equipment to support

physical/mental sensory needs ensuring the best life possible.

All of the proceeds of the 260 miles will go to support the tremendous efforts of our community in raising money for Kenzies Wish fund and will be one of many events underway and planned this year.

Whats The Target?

The fundraising target is £500 which will go directly to medical equipment and costs.  Every penny will directly make Kenzie’s life a little easier and a little better.

How Can I get Involved?

Regardeless of whether you can (or cant) afford to contribute cash, please follow Kenzies Wish Appeal on Facebook and share details of this and the many other events planned; the right person clicking and sharing can make a big difference.  You will also be able to see how Kenzie is getting along and the impact all of the efforts are having!

That’s all easily worth a couple of minutes to make a small donation.  This is a flexible fundraise effort so even if I don’t hit the £500 target every penny will still go to Kenzie; everyone can have a nice warm feeling that we have done something special for someone very special.  Plus you also get to see me suffer through 260 miles of pain but each one will be worth it!

story:
I Love My Mom

Hello, my name is Anna Monique. I'm the oldest child in our family. We are currently residing in Metro Manila, Philippines. I work as an online independent contractor for various business in United States, currently as content moderator, social media manager and virtual assistant. I'm active in social media, you can find me on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, LinkedIn, Pinterest, Instagram and here's my personal website.

I created this campaign to help us raise fund to pay for my Mom's chemotherapy and related expenses. Cancer treatment is exhausting for one's family pocket so we need your help with this.

Mom's treatment plan is like this:

  • Surgery (Opening of Stoma/Colostomy) DONE JULY 2012
  • Short Course Oral Chemotherapy + Radiation DONE OCTOBER 2012
  • Surgery (Lower Anal Resection) DONE DECEMBER 2012
  • Long Course Chemotherapy ASAP FEBRUARY 2013
  • Surgery (Closing of Stoma)

We are almost in the end of the treatment plan so we can't back out now! Together our family can overcome this trial if you could help us financially.

I love my Mom! Who doesn't? That's why I'm doing this for her. I want her to live long and be by my side and watch me achieve my goals and dream.

What We Need 

We need to raise fund as many, as much as possible, as soon as possible! Mom was advised to start her chemotherapy treatment as soon as possible. .

The chemotherapy treatment session cost breaks down like this:

  • The cost of chemotherapy drug.
  • The doctor's professional fee.
  • The 3 to 4 days hospital bill.

What You Get

I created some perks in hope to pay back for your kindness when you help. We really can't do more right now to pay back. We hope you'll get it to help us bulk our fund.

The Largest Heart Perks is the best! I really want to pay back so let me work for it.

I have been working as online independent contractor for more than two years now, I have my brother and friends as a team. We have some clients hired our group for data entry and other task. Count as in for your project needs!

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't think that you can’t contribute, not contributing to fund raising doesn’t mean you can’t help. There are some other ways for you to help!

  • Prayers for us through this hard times is very helpful.
  • Sharing this link to everyone you know.
  • Liking the Facebook page that we created:
    (www.facebook.com/helpmymomfightcancer)
  • Asking your friends to like the Facebook page and sharing this link.
  • Visiting the websites we created.
story_txt:
I Love My Mom
Hello, my name is Anna Monique. I'm the oldest child in our family. We are currently residing in Metro Manila, Philippines. I work as an online independent contractor for various business in United States, currently as content moderator, social media manager and virtual assistant. I'm active in social media, you can find me on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, LinkedIn, Pinterest, Instagram and here's my personal website.
I created this campaign to help us raise fund to pay for my Mom's chemotherapy and related expenses. Cancer treatment is exhausting for one's family pocket so we need your help with this.
Mom's treatment plan is like this:

Surgery (Opening of Stoma/Colostomy) DONE JULY 2012

Short Course Oral Chemotherapy + Radiation DONE OCTOBER 2012

Surgery (Lower Anal Resection) DONE DECEMBER 2012

Long Course Chemotherapy ASAP FEBRUARY 2013

Surgery (Closing of Stoma)

We are almost in the end of the treatment plan so we can't back out now! Together our family can overcome this trial if you could help us financially.
I love my Mom! Who doesn't? That's why I'm doing this for her. I want her to live long and be by my side and watch me achieve my goals and dream.

story:
Hello! 


Thank-you for your interest in Journey Free.  We are a small group working to provide help to people coping with Religious Trauma Syndrome and more broadly, seeking to educate the public about this pervasive problem.  We are based in the San Francisco Bay Area, where our director, Dr. Marlene Winell, has her therapy practice, and where most of our recovery retreats are held. 

 

A Journey Free retreat is a full weekend of healing and personal growth to help people who have suffered the effects of authoritarian religious indoctrination.   Dr. Winell has written the only self-help book about this and has been working in this area for 20 years.   Last year, she named Religious Trauma Syndrome as a kind of PTSD and began speaking and publishing on the subject.  In June, an article was in Cognitive Behavior Psychology Today.  


More and more people are leaving organized religion,1 and fundamentalist, rigid religions in particular.  The internet is starting to overflow with stories of RTS and cries for help.  On forums for former believers (such as exchristian.net), one can see the widespread pain and desperation. In response to my presentation about RTS on YouTube, a viewer commented:

Thank you so much. This is exciting because millions of people suffer from this. I have never heard of Dr. Marlene but more people are coming out to talk about this issue. Millions–who are quietly suffering and being treated for other issues when the fundamental issue is religious abuse.


 

However, there are very few services available to help people with the mental health problems and family ruptures that result.  Therapists are not trained in treating religious and spiritual issues – a serious problem that is recognized in the profession.2   There are a number of  obstacles to recognizing the issues of RTS and people face a lot of difficulty when they need assistance.  See Marlene's article;  Why RTS is So Invisible.

That’s where we come in and we need your help.  We are seeking to:

 

1.   Establish a scholarship fund to enable those in need to attend a recovery retreat, which is the most intense and effective way of helping people recover. 

 

2.   Support Marlene in traveling to conferences to speak about Religious Trauma Syndrome.   Sometimes expenses are paid, such as the upcoming Exmormon Foundation Conference in October, but professional and academic conferences are not.  These are important for educating the public and the mental health community.  Marlene’s paper has been accepted for the International Congress on Psychology and Religion held in Italy in August, and she needs help to attend!   This is her first opportunity to present to this kind of audience.  It would be progress in getting spiritual abuse recognized and treated.  

 

We are hoping to raise a total of $6000.   This would include $3200 to provide 8 people with financial aid to attend a retreat, and $2800 in travel funds to support Marlene.   


Any additional funds will go to these other projects:  1) Website development to enlarge the scope of information and resources offered, 2) Webinars on "Steps in Recovery,"  3)  Publishing of a collection of writings from people who have worked through RTS and want to give back, called Happy Heretics:  Tips for Healing, 4) Administrative assistance, 5)  Production of videos and a documentary film.  

 

Thank-you so much for any support you can offer!!! 


We have our eighth retreat coming up soon, and there are a number of people who would like to attend who need financial assistance.   Coming at all takes courage for someone with this background because the biggest issue in recovery is intense fear.  Christian fundamentalism also teaches that psychology is evil and that the secular world is dangerous.  So people coming to this retreat are taking a big step.     


"I am but a year into recovery from a lifetime I can only begin to describe as hellish. I am very interested in connecting with others who are also in their journey of freedom from religious traumatic pasts, and am considering the trip out west to attend one of your retreats; unaware these types of retreats existed, when I happened upon the information on your site, I burst into tears. Some of relief for the knowledge I am not alone, even more for the hope of being a participant one day."

 

But another problem is the cost of attending.  Many of the folks who most need help are also struggling financially.  They are often dealing with challenging career and family issues as PART OF the problem, which means they do not have as much ability or support to get services.  We have done our homework to find a retreat facility that is economical and also a supportive, healing environment.  We have volunteers helping and we do all our own cooking.  Participants are able to pay on a sliding scale basis, and financing is possible.  Yet we have basic costs and would like to create sponsorship options so that no one needs to be turned away due to lack of funds.  

 

The details of this program can be found at JourneyFree.org, including testimonials from former attendees, a full program, the retreat staff, photos, and FAQ.  Our YouTube channel has videos.  This letter was from a young man who created a very moving video series which dramatically illustrates how RTS can develop.

 

“I just saw your talk at the Texas Freethought Convention about what you call RTS.  I have been working on a youtube deconversion series. . . the first 3 parts so far are here.

"I've been working on the 4th part, focused on trauma, for better than a month now and having a hard time with it.   I've been reading a lot about trauma and finding myself amazed by how closely what we attribute to trauma and PTSD align with my experience of deconversion.  No one talks about religion and trauma.  Not in the scientific journals, not on trauma resources... I thought maybe I would be the only one to address it.  I love that you are fighting to name this.  You are doing important work."

 

The Impact

Participants have called the retreat experience "life-changing," a "turning-point," a "jump-start in recovery," and "transformative."  

 

An intensive intervention like this is needed because the trauma experienced by religious and spiritual abuse is deep and recovery is not easy.  The work of healing is not a simple intellectual process that can be done with reading a book, people feel terribly alone, and real help is hard to find. After doing eight retreats so far, we have found weekend retreats to be the approach with the most impact, followed up with membership in our online support group.   

You can hear from past participants on video and read comments on our site.  One person's longer story is below. 

This is how "Daniel" tells of coming to a retreat:  

           

“For the longest time I just thought there was something dreadfully wrong with me, and I continued to try to get rid of these feelings.  Around October of 2010 I listened to an episode of the Atheist Experience in which someone called in saying he had PTSD from coming out of religion.  After the call Matt Dillahunty started talking about Marlene Winell and how he heard her speak about RTS at a convention.  Immediately I knew that I had RTS.  This was good because I started to think of myself as having a condition that other people experienced also instead of believing that something was dreadfully wrong with only me.

                

“I soon found Marlene's website and was immediately drawn to the idea of a weekend retreat.  I had been living in isolation for so long with nobody to share my pain with.  I longed for the chance to share my story, my troubles, and to get some tools for recovery.  The retreat looked like it could offer this so after speaking with Marlene I signed up for the retreat.  Just the step of signing up seemed to be helpful in my path to recovery.  I felt like I was taking a courageous step forward for my own benefit.  I started to feel the faintest shimmer of hope. 

                

“The retreat proved to be far better than I expected.  It was so amazing to speak openly about my struggles, fears, and baggage from the past.  It provided a sense of community, acceptance, and I could feel the wall I had set up against the world was starting to come down.  The retreat also offered practical tools and exercises that I could implement at home on my own.  

                

“After coming home from the retreat I joined Marlene's online support group.  The best part of being in the group was I felt like I had people who were ready at a moments notice to listen, understand, and support me.  I also felt empowered by the fact that I could be an encouragement to them, and it felt really good to find ways to lift up and respond to others in the group.

                

“It has been almost a year since I first fell apart emotionally.  It is staggering to see how much growth I've experienced in that amount of time.  I went from feeling my life was over to feeling that my life has just begun.  I went from trying to shut out the world to wanting to welcome it back in.  I have learned how to accept and listen to my feelings, both positive and negative, and to express them.  I have learned to grieve what I have lost and to start dreaming again for the future.  I still struggle at times, and I feel like I will always be on a path towards recovery.  The difference now is that I have tools to deal with such episodes, and I am able to respond in much more effective and mature ways.” 

 The Need

Many people write who feel isolated and hurting, sometimes after many years, and are just realizing the real source of their suffering. We have heard repeated words of gratitude that finally someone has named the problem - RTS - and they feel less alone, less crazy, and more hopeful that help is available.  With these retreats, we want to reach as many as we can.   Here are a few of the many expressions of need we have received.  Go to this page for more stories of why folks need help.

 

These are "Karin’s" words, a woman who would like to attend the next retreat:

 

“Hello, I watched the talk you gave at the Texas Free Thought convention on your website. I wish that it could be on DVD.  I have watched it about 3 times.  I also ordered your e-book which I have read and will do so repeatedly. To be honest, I am glad that I gave myself a chance of being able to exist on this earth plane.  More therapists and the Mental Health Association should be made aware of Religious Trauma Syndrome and how it can have a damaging psychological effect on a person that lasts for many years.  For me, that is the worst kind of hell I have ever experienced.  I have no regrets of still being in physical existence in that I was able to learn about your book and to see your video.  I have hope. I can flourish. I can learn. Best of all, this has helped me come to the realization that I am not alone.  That there is help available. I knew there was a reason why I had to hold on. . .

 

“Everything about my living arrangements is up in the air.  Anyway, I'm not going to allow myself  to end up homeless.  But if the situation warrants it, then I still have to keep believing that I am not worthless.  I am interested in joining the forum, I just need some time to get some things taken care of. . .

 

“After ordering your e-book and reading it, your words have helped me to understand myself a lot better.  I appreciate you taking the time to read this.  No one but you has ever asked me to write out my story.  I remember when I was younger, I tried so hard to fit in, that I completely lost sight of who I was.  I tried to forget and go on as though nothing ever happened.  But it ended up that "the nothing ever happened" thing followed me everywhere I went, that the Word of God and prayer were not enough.  The day finally came that "yes Karin things did actually happen to you and it's time you dealt with it".  The physical and psychological abuse I endured at the hands of my so-called care-takers has caused me a lot of grief and problems.  It would be nice if all we needed was prayer and the Word of God but life as it turns out will never be as simple as that.  The people who are Christian Fundamentalists are creating the very demons that they fear. 

 

“There is a lot more to this life as I have discovered.  Thank you Marlene for being the voice of all of us who have suffered under the heavy hand of religion.  Thank You for acknowledging my presence and that I actually exist.  Thank you for believing that my story matters.”

 

Other ways to help:  

Helping us spread the word about RTS, let us know about opportunities to speak or do workshops or interviews, clerical assistance, website development, transcribing, video editing, writing stories for the media, free or inexpensive venues for retreats, frequent flyer miles for people attending retreats.   Or just write to us to tell us your story, share ideas or give some encouragement!   Thank-you, thank-you!    The Journey Free Team



 1 The American Religious Identification Survey (ARIS) from 2008 indicates that Americans by the millions are making an exodus from their faith. The number of people who affiliate themselves with “No religion” has nearly doubled from 1990 to 2008. The 18.7 million people who fall in this gap have presumably come from mainline Protestant, Baptist, and Catholic churches, which have lost 12.7 million believers during the same time frame.

2 David Lukoff (1998) reports: “In a survey of Association of Psychology Internship Centers training directors, 83% reported that discussions of religious and spiritual issues in training occurred rarely or never. One hundred per cent indicated they had received no education or training in religious or spiritual issues during their formal internship. Most of the training directors did not read professional literature addressing religious and spiritual issues in treatment, and they stated that little was being done at their internship sites to address these issues in clinical training (Lannert, 1991). A national study of APA member psychologists found that 85% reported rarely or never having discussed religion and spiritual issues during their own training (Shafranske & Maloney, 1990). Similar findings from other surveys suggest that this lack of training is the norm throughout the mental health professions (Sansone, Khatain & Rodenhauser, 1990)”. . . and concludes “Ignorance, countertransference, and lack of skill can impede the untrained psychologist's ethical provision of therapeutic services to clients who present with spiritual problems.”

story:
“A presence, which cannot be seen, touched, or heard, and that is expressed from the center of one's being to all of creation - connecting all of creation - this is known as the Aloha Spirit."

~Kauila Clark

Kauila Clark is a highly respected practitioner in the local Native Hawaiian community who has meaningful impact on international businesses, organizations, and local communities by sharing his extraordinary knowledge of the land, its people, and the principles of Aloha.  Through his gifts of knowledge and presence, he has brought the deep meaning of indigenous Hawaiian spirituality and wisdom to others - building bridges of understanding that have connected and touched countless lives on the island of Oahu and beyond.   Now, he finds himself and his family in need of some Aloha from others.  Kauila is suffering with health problems that limit his ability to give at levels previously sustained and his family is in need of assistance with everyday expenses and mounting medical bills. 

Kauila is a wisdom-keeper, a kupuna  (elder), a pillar of his community.  Certified in traditional Hawaiian practitices, Kauila is recognized as a leader in Kahu Hope,  Kahuna Laau Kahea,  Ho’oponopono,  Pule, (through Native Hawaiian Traditional Healing Arts and Cultural training by Master Practitioner Kamaki Kanahele);  and in “Shihan” (a living example of the arts from the Chozenji  Daihonsan, Academy of Zen and the Arts in Kalihi Valley).   His life has been committed to sharing with others the principle elements of Native Hawaiian values, Aloha, and physical well-being.  His clients have included the Halekulani Hotel, Marriott Ko’ Olina Resort, Oahu Visitors Bureau, and others.   Kauila served as President and CEO of West Oahu Employment Corporation, an employment and training Program in the needy Kapolei region.  With over 14 years of experience in counseling, Kauila has given his skills and expertise to local communities by serving as a member of the Board of Directors of the Waianae Coast Comprehensive Health Center and Chairman of the Board of the National Association of Community Health Centers, among other things. 

“In the Hawaiian tradition, the purpose of life - the meaning of our being here on Earth - is to fulfill a unique responsibility, our kuleana. This traditional way of looking at human existence addresses the age-old questions about the meaning of life, while grounding it in everyday practically. It invites each of us to reflect upon what our purpose may be - and how best to offer our gifts, talents and strengths to the world, intentionally and powerfully, for the enrichment of all beings. “  Kauila is a Hawaiian elder whose kuleana is to share “Native Hawaiian core values with future generations” and through his work, he passes his wisdom to others who can find new relevance in our modern-day world.

Kauila is deeply devoted to making Hawaii a living demonstration of the Aloha principles for everyone.  Please help him continue this important work by donating to his well-being and sharing your Aloha with him.  In doing so, you extend your Aloha to the world.  Mahalo
